triples.name: Phonology
triples.relevance: The paper analyzes phonological processes and their computational properties.

triples.name: Morphology (linguistics)
triples.relevance: The paper examines morphological processes with local triggers.

triples.name: Finite-state transducer
triples.relevance: The paper uses automata-theoretic characterization via finite-state transducers to model processes.

triples.name: Automata theory
triples.relevance: The paper employs automata-theoretic characterization to define strictly local functions.

triples.name: Formal language
triples.relevance: Strictly Local functions are defined as a subregular relation based on formal language theory.

triples.name: Metathesis (linguistics)
triples.relevance: The paper demonstrates that synchronic metathesis is a Strictly Local process.

triples.name: Reduplication
triples.relevance: The paper shows local partial reduplication is a Strictly Local process.

triples.name: Affix
triples.relevance: The paper analyzes general affixation as a Strictly Local phonological process.

triples.name: Computational linguistics
triples.relevance: The paper applies computational analysis to enhance understanding of phonological processes.

triples.name: Machine learning
triples.relevance: The paper presents a novel learning algorithm that provably learns Strictly Local functions.

triples.name: Subregular languages
triples.relevance: Strictly Local functions are introduced as a new subregular relation class.

triples.name: Local language (formal language)
triples.relevance: The paper builds on strictly local formal languages (McNaughton and Papert, 1971).
